meanings.definition: Likely to change, especially in one's loyalties or affections.
meanings.sent1: Her fickle friend changed plans at the last minute.
meanings.sent2: The weather in spring can be quite fickle.
meanings.sent3: The fickle cat decided to nap in the sunbeam instead of on the cozy blanket.
meanings.sent4: His fickle heart wandered from one crush to another.
meanings.sent5: The fickle wind shifted directions unpredictably during the storm.

meanings.definition: Changing frequently, especially in regards to one's opinions or desires.
meanings.sent1: The fickle customer couldn't decide on a flavor of ice cream.
meanings.sent2: Her fickle mood swings made it hard to predict her reactions.
meanings.sent3: The fickle toddler wanted the toy until he saw the shiny ball.
meanings.sent4: His fickle mind jumped from one idea to the next.
meanings.sent5: The fickle market caused uncertainty among investors.
